author.name: Licensed by Woolworths  ©️ Dorling Kindersley Ltd

description: This pie takes its name from the small limes that grow in the Florida Keys, where the recipe originated.
name: Key Lime Pie Recipe | Woolworths

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 180°C. Melt the butter in a saucepan over low heat. Add the biscuit crumbs and stir until well combined. Remove from the heat and tip the mixture into the flan tin, then use a spoon to press it evenly and firmly all over the base and sides of the tin. Place on a baking tray and bake for 510 minutes.
Meanwhile, finely grate the zest of 3 of the times into a bowl and, if you like, use a zester to pare long strands of zest from a fourth time to decorate. Juice all 5 times and set aside.

Place the egg yolks into the bowl with the lime zest, and whisk with an electric whisk until the egg has thickened. Pour in the condensed milk and continue whisking for another 5 minutes. Add the lime juice and whisk again until it is incorporated. Pour the mixture into the tin and bake for 1520 minutes or until set but still with a wobble in the centre.
Remove the pie from the oven and leave it to cool completely. Serve the pie decorated with the fine strands of lime zest, if using, and accompanied by pouring cream.
